titleStmt.title: Ieremy the prophete, translated into Englisshe: by George Ioye: some tyme felowe of Peter College in Camebridge. The songe of Moses is added in the ende, to magnifye our Lorde for the fall of the Pharao, the bisshop of Rome
Bible. O.T. Prophets. English. Joye. Selections.

Ieremy the prophete, translated into Englisshe: by George Ioye: some tyme felowe of Peter College in Camebridge. The songe of Moses is added in the ende, to magnifye our Lorde for the fall of the Pharao, the bisshop of Rome
Bible. O.T. Prophets. English. Joye. Selections.
titleStmt.author: Joye, George, d. 1553.

publicationStmt.date: Anno .M.D. and .xxxiiii. in the monethe of Maye [1534]

notesStmt.note: Place of publication and printer and publication date from STC.
Includes (on folio cxi ff.) the Song of Moses with caption title: The songe of Moses and his Chirche, songen after Pharasus dethe drowned with his horse in the redde sea.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
